definition: to develop/to make full use of
hair/Taiwan pr. [fa3]
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
abbr. for 揚州|扬州[Yang2 zhou1]/surname Yang
to raise/to hoist/the action of tossing or winnowing/scattering (in the wind)/to flutter/to propagate
variant of 揚|扬[yang2]
to develop and promote/to carry forward/to bring to great height of development
see 發揚踔厲|发扬踔厉[fa1 yang2 chuo1 li4]
to be full of vigor (idiom)

sentences.english: We will continue to carry forward the fine tradition of troops.
sentences.chinese: 我们将继续发扬部队的优良传统。

sentences.english: We are to push traditional Chinese medicine to the world and carry forward to a higher level of development.
sentences.chinese: 健心人要把中药推向世界，将其发扬光大。

sentences.english: The Red Army's glorious revolutionary traditions have carried over to the present day.
sentences.chinese: 红军的光荣革命传统一直发扬到今天。

sentences.english: "To expand my sect, I am willing to go even to the US to marry", he said.
sentences.chinese: “为了发扬教派，我还想去美国娶妻”，他说。

sentences.english: Second, promote democracy and conduct extensive consultation.
sentences.chinese: 第二，要发扬民主，广泛协商。

sentences.english: His disciples further developed this idea.
sentences.chinese: 道一的门下进一步发扬了这一思想。

sentences.english: Instead of imposing personal views upon others, we should promote democracy.
sentences.chinese: 我们应该发扬民主，而不应该将个人观点强加于他人。

sentences.english: People in Hongkong are fond of making soup.
sentences.chinese: 香港是广东“汤文化”的发扬光大者。

sentences.english: Democracy can be promoted through many channels.
sentences.chinese: 发扬民主可以经过很多渠道来实现。

sentences.english: So we have sufficient reason to carry forward and further develop it in perpetuity.
sentences.chinese: 我们有理由永远把它继承并发扬光大。

sentences.english: With the development of contemporary industry- a growing number of people are flowing into full-size cities.
sentences.chinese: 随着今世工业的发扬，越来越多的人涌向大都邑。

sentences.english: The second lesson is to prompt scholarship democracy and to encourage scholarly investigation of all forms.
sentences.chinese: 第二，发扬学术民主，鼓励作多种形式的学术探讨。

sentences.english: Everyone should fully develop on its own merits.
sentences.chinese: 每个人都应该充分发扬自己的优点。

sentences.english: In addition, the trampolinists need developing collective spirit and combatant spirit.
sentences.chinese: 此外，运动员还需要发扬团队精神和拼搏精神。

sentences.english: We need to maintain and promote actively instead of ignoring as pessimistically.
sentences.chinese: 要由消极的漠视走向积极的维护与发扬。

sentences.english: The second , the establishment of the old cadres'retirement system reflects and carries forward intra-Party democracy.
sentences.chinese: 其二，建立老干部离退休制度体现并发扬了党内民主。

definition: to enhance/to promote/to enrich
to develop and promote/to carry forward/to bring to great height of development
to pass on (to future generations)/passed on (from former times)/a continued tradition/an inheritance
lit. the flame of a burning piece of firewood passes on to the rest (idiom)/fig. (of knowledge, skill etc) to be passed on from teachers to students, one generation to another
variant of 弘揚|弘扬[hong2 yang2]
to dare to be first/to pioneer (idiom)
to take orders/to receive commands/to carry on (a tradition)
vigor/vitality/drive/spiritual
spirit/mind/consciousness/thought/mental/psychological/essence/gist/CL:個|个[ge4]
to follow the past and herald the future (idiom); part of a historical transition/forming a bridge between earlier and later stages
creativity
the Chinese people
incorporating diverse things (idiom)/eclectic/all-embracing
cultural tradition
the mission in life of a deceased person, left to others to carry on
to practice what one preaches (idiom)
passed on from generation to generation (idiom); to hand down
